intro: Euthamia remota, commonly known as the distant eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and open woodlands, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Euthamia remota is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
